content: Cryptographic techniques are widely used in privacy-preserving authentication methods for VANETs. These techniques include digital signatures, public-key encryption, and symmetric-key encryption, which can be used to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and authenticity of the information exchanged in VANETs. Digital signatures, for example, can be used to authenticate the identity of vehicles and to ensure that the messages exchanged in VANETs are not tampered with. Public-key encryption can be used to encrypt messages so that only the intended recipient can read them, while symmetric-key encryption can be used to encrypt messages quickly and efficiently. Additionally, cryptographic techniques such as zero-knowledge proof, homomorphic encryption, and secure multi-party computation can be used to authenticate the identity of vehicles in a privacy-preserving manner.
